definition: everyone present/the whole audience/across-the-board/unanimously/whole duration (of a competition or match)
all/whole/entire/every/complete
surname Quan
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
variant of 場|场[chang2]
variant of 場|场[chang3]
unanimous

sentences.english: Learn how to make some all-occasion cards using rubber stamps with flower designs.
sentences.chinese: 了解如何使一些全场合用花卡设计橡皮图章。

sentences.english: The full-court press is legs, not arms.
sentences.chinese: 全场紧逼靠的是脚，而非手。

sentences.english: Receives time invited entire audience's friend.
sentences.chinese: 接下来的时间有请全场的朋友。

sentences.english: This par three is short and sweet coming in as the shortest hole on the course.
sentences.chinese: 短而精的球洞，是全场最短的三杆洞。

sentences.english: Diego Milito with a goal five minutes before half-time.
sentences.chinese: 迭戈米利托在半场结束五分钟前攻入了全场唯一入球。

sentences.english: The cheer of the fan echo round the grind as the team appear.
sentences.chinese: 球队刚一上场，球迷的欢呼声立即响遍全场。

sentences.english: Do you know how to play full-court press?
sentences.chinese: 你会打全场区域紧逼吗？

sentences.english: When Minny shot 40 total free throws… the Rox 19 for the whole game.
sentences.chinese: 森林狼全场获得40次罚球，而火箭只有19次。

sentences.english: The excellent acrobatic performance brought down the house.
sentences.chinese: 精采的杂技表演博得全场喝采。

sentences.english: Pepe Reina and Alvaro Arbeloa played the full game while Albert Riera played for 80 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 雷纳和阿贝罗啊踢满全场，列拉则踢了80分钟。

sentences.english: The entire hall burst into thunderous cheers.
sentences.chinese: 全场发出了雷鸣般的欢呼。
全场的观众都听得入迷了。

sentences.english: There were loud cheers AS the Irish team took the field.
sentences.chinese: 爱尔兰队一入场，全场立刻欢声雷动。

sentences.english: Our school has a full- court basketball tournament every year.
sentences.chinese: 我们学校的全场篮球赛每年一次。

sentences.english: He never used the full-court press the same way again.
sentences.chinese: 在余下的赛季，他再也没那样使用全场紧逼。

sentences.english: The audience stood quietly for both anthems and burst into applause at the end.
sentences.chinese: 全场观众静立，而后爆发出一片掌声。

definition: to begin/to open/to start/beginning of an event
to go on stage/fig. to appear on the scene/used in advertising to mean new product
(of a performer) to come onto the stage to perform/(of an athlete) to enter the arena to compete/(fig.) to enter the scene (e.g. a new product)/(of an examinee etc) to leave the venue
on stage/to go on stage/to take the field
competition (sports etc)/match/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]/to compete
thunderous applause (idiom)
half of a game or contest/half-court
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
to score
penalty shot/penalty kick (in sports)
debut
end (of a performance or sports match)/last round of testing in the imperial examinations
to be present/to be on the scene
everyone present applauds/universal acclaim/a standing ovation/to bring the house down
to arrest/to capture/to seize/to win (a set, a game etc)
backboard
